definitions.definition: ( now rare ) The stalk or stem of a plant. [from 10th c.]
A young shoot of a plant; a spear . [from 14th c.]
Any of various tall grasses, rushes, or sedges, such as the marram , the reed canary-grass, etc.
A sharp or tapering point . [from 16th c.]
( architecture ) A tapering structure built on a roof or tower , especially as one of the central architectural features of a church or cathedral roof. [from 16th c.]
examples: The spire of the church rose high above the town.

definitions.definition: The top, or uppermost point, of anything; the summit. [from 17th c.]
( mining ) A tube or fuse for communicating fire to the charge in blasting .

main_definition: ( now rare ) The stalk or stem of a plant. [from 10th c.]
secondary_definitions: A young shoot of a plant; a spear . [from 14th c.]
Any of various tall grasses, rushes, or sedges, such as the marram , the reed canary-grass, etc.
A sharp or tapering point . [from 16th c.]
( architecture ) A tapering structure built on a roof or tower , especially as one of the central architectural features of a church or cathedral roof. [from 16th c.]
The top, or uppermost point, of anything; the summit. [from 17th c.]
( mining ) A tube or fuse for communicating fire to the charge in blasting .

definitions.definition: One of the sinuous foldings of a serpent or other reptile; a coil .
The part of a spiral generated in one revolution of the straight line about the pole .

main_definition: One of the sinuous foldings of a serpent or other reptile; a coil . [from 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( geometry ) The part of a spiral generated in one revolution of the straight line about the pole .
